e4: Shifting to a policy of reporting unbiased earnings demonstrates commitment to transparency and ethical standards. It maintains the integrity of the firm's financial practices, reduces legal exposure, and ensures honest communication with investors. Though some investors may initially misunderstand, educating them can clarify the change and bolster trust with transparent reporting. e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, accurate, and consistent, presenting financial information without intentional distortion or omission. It should prioritize truthfulness, ensuring investors and stakeholders can make informed decisions. Ethical reporting also respects legal standards and recognizes the impact of financial disclosures on all types of investors, fostering trust and accountability. It involves clear communication of any changes, and the company should maintain an open dialogue with the investor community to explain transitions, minimizing misunderstanding and preferring long-term trust over short-term benefits.
e6: Yes, I would ask about the plan to communicate the policy change to investors and how the company intends to manage short-term market reactions. Additionally, I would inquire about strategies to engage and educate both retail and institutional investors to ensure clarity regarding the objective of transparency. Lastly, I would be interested in understanding what risk assessments or analyses have been performed regarding the successful implementation of this transition.
